text:
CHAPTER 1 
INTRODUCTION
 
18 
 
1.1.2 Types Of OCR 
 
 
Optical character recognition (OCR) is usually referred to as an 
off-line character recognition process [11], meaning that the system 
scans and recognizes static images of the characters.  It refers to the 
mechanical or electronic translation of images of Handwritten 
characters or printed text into machine code without any variation. 
 
Figure 1.1 [12] shows types of OCR [13]. 
 
 
Figure 1.1: Types of character recognition 
 
1.1.2.1 
Arabic Printed and Handwritten OCR 
 
The characters are written on paper or directly on a touch screen 
using a pen or fingers. Printed OCR takes an image containing printed text 
as input and converts it into editable text.
